intro: Lasianthaea crocea, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lasianthaea crocea is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
